content.description:
Start in the slot just right of

Alt Left's

pitch one hand crack, ascend ledge systems that rise to the right to a large ledge with a bolted anchor below the ar√©te. Follow the hand crack right of the arete with occasional wide sections. Undercling the roof, and traverse ledge to a bolted anchor.

Rappel route (two 60m rope are required) or summit in two pitches of loose Fourth Class, and descend the south face with a short downclimb and one single rope rappel to a saddle. (See

Alt Left's

descent description.)
content.protection: Wires, double cams to 4". There are two bolt anchors/rappel stations at the belay ledges.

content.description: Follow prominent hand cracks up the left center face of the head wall for two pitches. Two more pitches of easy fifth and loose fourth lead to the summit.
content.location: To descend from the summit, downclimb a slot on the south face to a loose ledge with a rappel bolt. Rap to the saddle, slide down scree, and traverse ledge systems at the cairn around the toe of the buttress to get back to the packs.
